concise_definition: n. 过量, 过度, 额外部分

definitions.explanation_en: An amount or degree that is more than what is necessary, permitted, or desirable, often leading to negative consequences.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指超过必要、允许或理想程度的数量或程度，常导致负面后果。
definitions.example_en: The excess of sugar in his diet contributed to his health problems.
definitions.example_cn: 他饮食中糖分过多，导致了健康问题。

definitions.explanation_en: Something that remains after what is needed or used has been taken; surplus or leftover portion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在满足所需或使用后剩余的部分，即盈余或多余部分。
definitions.example_en: The company sold its excess inventory at a discount to free up warehouse space.
definitions.example_cn: 公司以折扣价出售了多余的库存，以腾出仓库空间。

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something that is more than is needed, allowed, or reasonable; going beyond limits.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某事物超出所需、允许或合理范围，超越了限度。
definitions.example_en: He was fined for excess speed on the highway.
definitions.example_cn: 他因在高速公路上超速而被罚款。

comparison.analysis: “Surplus”（盈余）通常用于经济或物资语境，指在满足需求后剩余的、可被储存或出售的量，带有中性甚至积极的含义。而 “excess” 更常带有负面色彩，暗示超出合理或可接受的界限，可能引发问题。
“Overload”（超载）强调系统或个体因承受过多而达到极限，常用于物理负荷或心理压力，隐含“不堪重负”的含义。而 “excess” 更广泛，仅表示数量或程度上的超出，不一定导致崩溃。
“Abundance”（丰富）指大量存在，通常带有积极或充裕的含义，如资源丰富、爱意丰盈。而 “excess” 强调的是“过度”，常含批评或警示意味，表示已超出有益的范围。
